title: Barcelona get major boost despite losing US friendly
body_text:
By Web Desk
December 23, 2023
Spanish football club FC Barcelona got a major boost despite losing 3-2 to Club America yesterday in Texas.
Barcelona fans might have been unhappy to see their already short squad taking the field once again just over 24 hours after they beat Almeria 3-2 on Thursday night but the financial side of things paint a different picture.
According to Marca, the match helped Barca earn €4.5m, which will help them recover some of the money they missed out on after losing two matches during the UEFA Champions League group stage. The report added that the UCL defeats left the club €5.6m short of their maximum pot.
Only four first-team players began the match since the senior players were tired, according to manager Xavi.
“There are footballers who are not their age and are in the first team. 16, 17, 18, 19 years old, it’s very early for them, it’s a lot of responsibility. But it is what it affects due to the economic situation of the club. This situation makes us adapt and it is something that adds to us as an entity,” he told Sport.
He also lauded former teammate Rafael Marquez, who as Barca Atletic manager is coaching quite a few of those players.
“Rafa Marquez is training the youngsters very well. We have taken advantage of this match to give them opportunities because they deserve them. It was an open match with many chances so people will have enjoyed it. For us it is a pleasure to be in the United States,” Xavi added.
Lamine Yamal and Marc Guiu scored for Barcelona during the match. Meanwhile, Diego Kochen, Ander Astralaga, Unai Hernandez, Gerard Martin, Pau Prim and Mamadou Mbacke made an appearance for the senior side for the first time.
